NATIONAL NEWS






Going NGV interest free



May 4--PTT Plc joined yesterday with Thanachart Bank, Krungthai Card Plc and Aeon Thana Sinsap (Thailand) Plc to offer interest-free loans to drivers seeking to install natural gas for vehicle (NGV) equipment.  The three financial institutions will offer the loans, with repayment terms from 10 to 36 months, until Sept 30. A motorist who modifies a car for NGV by paying cash at a PTT-certified ...


May 4, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



S.J. PG&E customers can save a cool buck by conserving: Company expands SmartAC program



May 3--MANTECA -- Pacific Gas and Electric Co. has launched the second phase of a San Joaquin Countywide program that lets the utility remotely turn air conditioning off and on in cycles during hot summer days when demand strains the power network.  A first phase in Stockton garnered 1,900 sign-ups -- and 900 equipment installations so far -- after a March 21 rollout, a good start for a program ...


May 3, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Virginia State Corporation Commission now considering Appalachian Power's proposed rate increase



May 3--On the Web:  www.scc.virginia.gov www.appalachianpower.com After being deluged with public comment, the Virginia State Corporation Commission is now considering Appalachian Power's proposed rate increase. The utility, which provides electricity to about 500,000 customers in Southwest Virginia, got preliminary approval last year to raise its rates 25.4 percent.


May 3, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News





DTE leader repeats call for new nuclear reactor in Michigan



DETROIT -- DTE Energy Co. CEO Anthony Earley told shareholders today the company's cost containment strategy is on track and called for state lawmakers to revamp legislation that would help bring a new nuclear reactor to Michigan. Earley, speaking at the utility's annual meeting at its downtown headquarters, reported that DTE netted $95 million in annual cost savings in 2006.

More rules needed for wind power, study concludes



Web Tools: Appalachian states lack strong and detailed guidelines to regulate the continued growth of wind power facilities along the Mid-Atlantic highlands, according to a new study by the National Academy of Sciences. West Coast Leads the Nation in Planned Natural Gas Fired Unit Additions



Researched by Industrial Info Resources  Researched by Industrial Info Resources (Sugar Land, Texas). In spite of a significant reduction in the number of natural gas fired unit additions planned in the U.S. since the bull days of the early 2000s, the industry is evaluating more than 45,000 megawatts (MW) of natural gas fired unit additions across the U.S. Natural gas represents only about 15% of ...

Fitch Comments on NRG's Common Dividend Plan



NEW YORK--(BUSINESS WIRE)--According to Fitch Ratings, NRG Energy Inc.'s (NRG; Issuer Default Rating (IDR) 'B', with a Stable Rating Outlook) announcement yesterday that it plans to pay a common dividend beginning 2008 through the creation of a holding company structure does not immediately affect the company's ratings or rating Outlook. As proposed, NRG would create a parent holding company that ...

CMS Energy Reports First Quarter Results and Affirms Adjusted Earnings Guidance



JACKSON, Mich., May 3 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- CMS Energy announced today a net loss of $215 million, or $0.97 per share, for the first quarter of 2007 compared to a net loss of $27 million, or $0.12 per share, in the same quarter of 2006. CMS Energy's adjusted first quarter net income, which excludes impairment charges and other items, was $94 million, or $0.43 per share, compared to a net ...

Allegheny Energy Finalizes Contract for Scrubber Project at Fort Martin Power Station



GREENSBURG, Pa.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Allegheny Energy, Inc. (NYSE:AYE) today announced that it has signed an agreement for engineering and construction work related to the installation of flue gas desulfurization equipment (scrubbers) at the coal-fired Fort Martin Power Station. The scrubbers will reduce sulfur dioxide emissions by approximately 95 percent and significantly reduce mercury emissions ...


May 3, 2007 Business Wire





FERC acts to remove barriers to renewable energy development in California



The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) recently approved the California Independent System Operator's (CAISO) proposed mechanism for financing facilities to interconnect location-constrained renewable resources such as wind, geothermal and solar generation to the CAISO's transmission grid. The Commission found that the CAISO's proposal strikes a reasonable balance that addresses barriers ...


May 3, 2007 FMLink



Experts report promise, perils of wind power



WASHINGTON - Wind farms could generate as much as 7 percent of U.S. electricity in 15 years, but policymakers need to better consider the overall impacts, such as the threat spinning blades pose to birds and bats, a panel of the National Research Council reported Thursday.The towers appear most dangerous to night-migrating songbirds, bats and some hunting birds, but not enough about the risks is ...


May 3, 2007 MSNBC



Wind farms useful but may threaten birds



WASHINGTON -- Wind farms could generate up to 7 percent of U.S. electricity in 15 years, but scientists want more study of the threat the spinning blades pose to birds and bats. The towers appear most dangerous to night-migrating songbirds, bats and some hunting birds such as hawks and eagles. The risk is not understood enough to draw conclusions, a National Research Council panel said Thursday ...

Coveted Econoburn Boilers Drawing Dealers' Attention



Three new heating, plumbing and HVAC contractors and furnace dealers have lined up to add the Econoburn wood gasification boiler to their product offerings. The made in America boiler with a custom designed, high-technology refractory is energy efficient and enviornmentally friendly. With ASME certification and a ISO 2000-9001 certified manufacturing process, the Econoburn boiler is ...

Comverge reaches 126-MW demand reduction deal with Nevada Power



Comverge has entered into a demand-reduction agreement with Nevada Power that will supply the Las Vegas-based utility with a 'virtual peaking capacity' program of up to 126 MW, the East Hanover, New Jersey-based demand-response company said Thursday. As part of the two-year deal, Comverge will operate Nevada Power's existing 15-MW to 19-MW demand-response system, which comprises thermostats and ...

Entergy New Orleans says it is ready to emerge from bankruptcy



Birmingham, Alabama (Platts)--3May2007  Entergy New Orleans, which filed for Chapter 11 protection in September 2005 after its electricity and natural gas distribution systems were shattered by Hurricane Katrina, is prepared to emerge from bankruptcy immediately if the US Bankruptcy Court judge approves its reorganization plan at a Thursday hearing, the company said in documents filed with the ...

European electricity prices could rise to record levels this summer



LONDON: Electricity prices could reach record highs in Europe as forecasters predict a second straight summer of soaring temperatures. 'The chances are we will see significant increases in prices,' said Kim Keats, head of the power and fuels group at ICF International, a consulting firm in London. The price of baseload electricity for next quarter in Germany, the biggest European market, has ...

Synfuels plant once considered white elephant now a "crown jewel"

Rosneft subsidiary wins auction for major unit of bankrupt Yukos oil company



MOSCOW: A subsidiary of state-controlled OAO Rosneft won the bidding for several Yukos units on Thursday with an offer of 175.7 billion rubles (US$6.8 billion; ,5 billion), the latest chapter in the piece-by-piece liquidation of the bankrupt oil company.
